name: termix
description: Termix is a self-hosted SSH management platform that exposes terminals in the browser. It lets admins organize hosts, manage keys, and open shell sessions directly from a web interface.
features: Browser-based SSH: Access SSH terminals directly in your web browser without installing client software.
Host management: Organize and manage SSH hosts with groups, tags, and custom connection settings.
Key management: Store and manage SSH keys securely with support for multiple keys per host.
Multi-session: Open multiple SSH sessions simultaneously in tabs for efficient server management.
Connection sharing: Share terminal sessions with team members for collaborative troubleshooting and pair administration.
Web interface: Access your servers from any device with a modern, responsive web interface.
Session persistence: Maintain SSH sessions even when closing the browser with automatic reconnection.
Command history: Access command history across sessions for quick reference and repeated operations.
File transfer: Upload and download files through the web interface using SFTP integration.
Custom themes: Personalize the terminal appearance with color schemes and font customization.
Mobile support: Manage servers from mobile devices with touch-optimized controls and keyboard.
Access control: Define user permissions and restrict access to specific hosts or host groups.
